case_vignette:
A 25-year-old man presents the office for a 3-day history of fever and fatigue. Upon further questioning, he says that he also had constant muscular pain, headaches, and fever during these days. He adds additional information by giving a history of regular unprotected sexual relationship with multiple partners. He is a non-smoker and drinks alcohol occasionally. The heart rate is 102/min, respiratory rate is 18/min, temperature is 38.0°C (100.4°F), and blood pressure is 120/80 mm Hg. On physical examination, he is icteric and hepatosplenomegaly is evident with diffuse muscular and abdominal tenderness particularly in the right upper quadrant. The serologic markers show the following pattern:
Anti-HAV IgM negative
HBsAg positive
Anti-HBs negative
IgM anti-HBc positive
Anti-HCV negative
Anti-HDV negative
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling feverish and really tired for the past three days, along with constant muscle pain and headaches.
Have you had any difficulty breathing or coughing up any mucus?
No, I haven't had any difficulty breathing or coughing up mucus.
Have you had any contact with anyone who has recently been sick or traveled to a high-risk area for a contagious illness?
I haven't mentioned any specific contact with sick individuals or travel to high-risk areas.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
I didn't mention any changes in appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle or sexual activity?
I've had regular unprotected sexual relations with multiple partners.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or difficulty sleeping?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my sleep patterns or difficulty sleeping.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
I didn't mention any changes in my diet or eating habits.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress levels or work schedule?
I haven't mentioned any changes in stress levels or work schedule.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I didn't mention taking any medication or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
I didn't mention any changes in my family or medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Influenza.

The patient denies any difficulty breathing or coughing up mucus. There has been no specific contact with sick individuals or travel to high-risk areas. The patient has had regular unprotected sexual relations with multiple partners and has not mentioned any changes in appetite or weight. There have been no changes mentioned in sleep patterns or difficulty sleeping, diet or eating habits, stress levels, work schedule, medication or supplements, or family or medical history.
